DOC.brief_summary: This study aim assess effect two different type intervention aim increase happiness Flemish general population compare individual receive intervention .
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize trial two aim : 1 . First , investigate efficacy two different happiness intervention increase feeling happiness Flemish general population use wait-list controlled design . 2 . Second , study aim identify predictor response intervention ( `` work ? '' ) Methods Design procedure - Participants contact social medium direct website specifically design study . - All participant register study first electronically sign informed consent ask complete brief battery questionnaire online ( base line measure ) randomization . - Participants assign randomly use block-randomized design one three condition use computerized algorithm : 1. condition daily small concrete happiness tip send participant one month via email ( n=400 ) 2. condition weekly in-depth happiness tip ( experience ) task give one month via email ( n=400 ) 3. wait-list condition ( 1 month ) ; participant subsequently ( end 4-week intervention ) randomize condition ( ) ( b ) ( n=400 ) use block-randomized design . - All participant assess weekly intervention ( see ) followed-up 6 month end study . Measures Participants complete detailed demographic questionnaire . Primary outcome measure : - Subjective Happiness Scale ( SHS ; Lyubomirsky & Lepper , 1999 ) - Steen Happiness Inventory ( SHI ; Seligman , Steen , Park , & Peterson , 2005 ) Secondary outcome measure - Positive Negative Affect Scales ( PANAS ; Watson , Clark , & Tellegen , 1988 ) - Patient Health Questionnaire-9 ( PHQ-9 ; Kroenke , Spitzer , & Williams , 2001 ) - Warwick Edinburgh Mental Well-Being Scale ( WEMWBS ; Tennant et al. , 2007 ) - Brief Symptom Inventory ( Korte KlachtenLijst ; KKL ; Lange , & Appelo , 2007 ) Predictors outcome - Meaning Life Questionnaire ( MLQ ; Steger , Frazier , Oishi , & Kaler , 2006 ) - Depressive Experiences Questionnaire ( DEQ ; Blatt , D'Afflitti , & Quinlan , 1976 ) - Experiences Close Relationships-Revised ( ECR-R , Fraley , Waller , & Brennan , 2000 ) - Kentucky Inventory Mindfulness ( KIMS ; Baer , Smith , & Allen , 2004 ) - Toronto Alexithymia Scale ( TAS ; Bagby , Parker , & Taylor , 1994 ) Data analysis Repeated measure Anova multilevel model use ass difference three condition primary secondary outcome end intervention follow-up . Regression analyse growth curve model use examine effect predictor primary secondary outcome .
DOC.criteria: Sufficient fluency Flemish least 18 year age fluency Flemish living outside Flanders
